comment: Purchased for a friend and myself to sip on during a get together. We were both surprised how good it was for the monitary value. The bottle presents well and is a welcome addition to the collection
Sweet-ish and not heavy on rye flavour. Bought it on a whim. Surprisingly good. Recommend!
Surprised for an affordable dram this is very smooth and easy drinking.
Fruity and leather on the nose.  Very sweet and smooth, with some spice on the tongue.  Finish burns and lingers with a tingle on the tongue

Nice presentation, unique color the packaging will attract attention on the shelf.
 subtle aroma lends a hint of an interesting flavor to come.

This whiskey has a bit of an edge to it not something everyone will like but I find it enjoyable too many brands are afraid of this sort of statement.

The flavors are nicely blended and the wine cask flavor is right there front and center with the others joining in over time  then everything clears out very smoothly.

For me at least this is not so much a mixer as a sipping experience.

This is likely to be a regular in the cabinet.
Not up to my expectations, high alcohol first taste a turn off. No competition for 40 Creek, or Crown Royal. Would not recommend

Genuinely surprised with this whisky. I find myself enjoying it far more than I expected.  Perhaps a little too sweet, but it has an excellent fruity aroma and a smooth finish. The rye adds some spice but it is balanced well with maybe some carmel notes and a little wood notes too. A great sipping or dessert whisky.
This is not what I was expecting at all from the 99, the glass was in my hand for at least an hour and a half, it was so bad i could not get around it. Sad!

I'm not sure about the Distiller's review as I do not get any of the notes Blair has expressed. I get a full bouquet of dark fruit and dried fruit. The wine casks that it was finished in come through on the finish with some spiciness and grape jelly. At $35/bottle here in Ontario I figured this would be, at best, a good mixer. What a fantastic surprise to uncover a new Canadian sipper (I'll mix it with something eventually but it's really not necessary). Red wine and whisky, nothing but good stuff!

I'm not gonna wax poetics here or use cheesy hockey analogies, but I will say it's good... and winy, obviously. The nose evokes wine, vanilla and almost maple syrup. The palate is all oak (and almost overbearing) with tannin hitting your tongue. The finish is fleeting yet pleasant. I'd definitely drink it again (hell, dozens of times), but even at $40 CAD, I still wouldn't buy it.
being a huge LA Kings fan, I so desperately want to own a bottle of this.
Surprisingly smooth, to the point a non whiskey drinker would enjoy it. Smokey, roses, smooth, alcohol, oak. Let's be honest, I'd put it on my shelf
The red cask really comes through, very unique rye. Might pass on the $40 bottle though. 3.5/5
Oak, slight brown sugar, gentle spice and grape tannin flavour and dryness. Comes across thin. Good but it lacks body. $35 in Ontario.
Mostly oak on the nose, balanced sweet palate with brown sugar, vanilla and gentle spice on the tongue. Otherwise, the finish is very short. Worth trying, but not worth buying for me.
Nose: dark fruit and red wine.  Taste: Oily and red wine.  Bit of sweet.  Sweet long finish. @Natalie-Martinelli

I get lots of caramel and toffee notes on the nose. It has a short life on the palate with a rather distinct red wine finish.
A definite sipping whiskey (I feel it's more of a dessert drink) and for the price it's one I'll be contemplating picking up next time.

I’d rate this 3 1/2 stars but the app won’t let me. I’ll give it the extra half star for being a great value for money. Lots of dark brown sugar and a floral note with a hint of leather on the nose. It’s got a fairly rich mouthfeel for a whisky that’s only bottled at 40% ABV. The finish is medium-short and there is a distinct red grape note there. I’m impressed.
I get the fruitiness, rich being the way they describe it sounds accurate
$50 in Alberta. Red wine cask caught my eyes but not too special. Bit sharp with some complexity.

nose very faint, vanilla, 
taste leather, dried fruit, vanilla, very smooth
finish little spice, sweetness
Smells like glue. Tastes like sweet glue. Tingly spice on the tongue. Oily feel. Maybe a hint of wood. This is like walking through a furniture factory. 6/29/18

This is more along the lines of what I expected from Angel's Envy. It has a  fairly similar palate as Straight Edge Bourbon but not quite the same edge. Easy drinker, inoffensive. Apples, cherries, and some hints of dark fruit on the end.

I’m tasting this at the bar at YVR. I’m a huge fan of Canadian whiskey, but I don’t love this. The nose is indeed rather gluey, with a pleasant fruity warmth. Lots of spice is nice, but the red wine aftertaste (think dregs from last night’s glass, not sherried scotch) is... weird. Some sips I’d almost go for a 4, but then I think 3 max. The expert rating is surprising.
Great full flavour. Smooth and the red cask really stands out.
Less of a rubbery finish than the ice wine cask version

Not sold on this one. The nose is a mix of leather/smoke with touches of citrus. The body is oily but harsh. There’s not a lot of flavor while resting on the tongue and has a mild/moderate burn when swallowed. The after taste is somewhat pleasant as it reminds me of a mixture of red wine in the beginning and a bit of caramel within a minute or two. It’s an adventure of aroma and flavor, but I think I’ll pass on the next trip.
Great flavors. So smooth. Reminds me of my favorite red wine Cooper and Thief.

Very sharp oak. No complexity. One note flavour. Tastes very young. Not enjoyable at all. Huge amount of young alcohol burn. Needs to be put back in the cask, possibly aged in a more heavily used barrel. Based on the other reviews, they must be bottling in small batches and the inconsistency is astounding. Would not be as critical if it was half the price. Much better value available on the market.

Tasted Feb 10, 2018. Dad’s bottle, picked up at Sobey’s Emerald Park. Easy pour. Nose dominated by rubber inflatables, vanilla and light spices. Carries to taste with some caramel and dark rum on the tongue. Easy finish. Would pick up a bottle.
this is super smooth. not much if any burn.

Not very enjoyable! Tastes of a young patched together whiskey for the sake of selling bottles. I do not drink this neat anymore. Use it for mixed cocktails only and still hesitant when mixing a drink. Did not enjoy any of the bottling from Wayne Gretzky, including the wines and ice wines. Unfortunately they do not live up to the great ones hockey performance! Sad, very sad.
Red wine cask gives smooth taste
Initial smoky tones lead to a tantalizing tingle on the tongue from the fruit and tannins from the aging casks

Didn’t find the nose very interesting, but the leather and caramel on the palette was a nice surprise and made it interesting for Canadian whisky. Finish tastes like dark fruit which must be from the wine casks

Nothing about this drink is bad... but there's nothing compelling about it either. The wine notes are not heavy enough to warrant the red cask tag on it's label. The tasting notes of leather and brown sugar are clear. I'm glad I tried it but I wish I would have tried it at a bar first before purchasing a bottle. I would never turn it away but i don't anticipate purchasing a second bottle. The rating of 90 is probably a few points too high. Good not great.
Great rye for the price. The red wine finish helps offset the rye spice
Rum like finish.  Buttery, caramel body with sweet finish.  Very sweet, bit of spicy rye at the back end.
Very sweet almost feels like added cherry flavor or something.
Surprisingly good. Very smooth. Very mild peaty undertones, which I normally dislike.
Solid, sweet, bourbon comes through. Too simple and sweet to be great but it's smooth and worth drinking.

not unpleasant nose, but not noticable bourbon notes although aged 3 years in bourbon barrels. taste is sweet and smooth from it's last 6 months aging in wine barrel.

not harsh, no burn even when chomping.

finish is akin to cinnamon red hots.
Really good for a hockey player. 🤨
Sweet, insipid... awful. If you enjoy whiskies without any character or identity, look no further.

Solid 3 but nothing more.

$39.95 in Ontario
It’s got a pretty good rating for something that’s average at best.
surprisingly good but on the sweet side

This dram is a bit of a riddle for me. On the the nose there is smoke, and behind it is caramel. However on the palate, up front is a sweet taste of vanilla, and a lingering taste of caramel maybe. However, I cannot find the smoke that I melt. Maybe this if a different kind of smoke than the peat I am used too
Truly surprised. Red wine cask is apparent in flavour profile. Up there with good scotch in my books!

An unassuming rye. It’s definitely not a top goal scorer, the boozy nose leads me to believe that this whiskey could hardly tie up it’s own skates. 

On second nosing, I get burnt cotton candy, and vanilla. In the mouth, The sweetness quickly fades and is replaced with and a mild chilli heat that hits moderately and slowly fades. What it lacks in complexity, it makes up for in wearing the number 99.

Overpriced.
Sweet, metallic, leather on the nose. Taste is maple, brown sugar, dry red wine finish

Heavy alcohol on the nose.  
Nice burn finish.
Very smooth like Great One was on the ice. Hints of leather and a little smoky as well
